articles.title: Blue-collar jobs are gaining popularity as AI threatens office work
articles.summary: Geoffrey Hinton’s message on a recent podcast about artificial intelligence was simple: “Train to be a plumber.”Hinton, a Nobel Prize-winning computer scientist often called “the Godfather of AI,” said in June what people have now been saying for years: Jobs that include manual labor and expertise are the least vulnerable to modern technology than some other career paths, many of which have generally been considered more respected and more lucrative.
articles.translated_title: Blue-collar jobs are gaining popularity as AI threatens office work

articles.title: Robots race, play football, crash and collapse at China’s ‘robot Olympics’
articles.summary: China kicked off the three-day long World Humanoid Robot Games on Friday, looking to showcase its advances in artificial intelligence and robotics with 280 teams from 16 countries.
articles.translated_title: Robots race, play football, crash and collapse at China’s ‘robot Olympics’

articles.title: Meta plans fourth restructuring of AI efforts in six months, The Information reports
articles.summary: Meta is planning its fourth overhaul of artificial intelligence efforts in six months, The Information reported on Friday, citing three people familiar with the matter.
articles.translated_title: Meta plans fourth restructuring of AI efforts in six months, The Information reports
articles.translated_summary: Meta is planning its fourth overhaul of artificial intelligence efforts in six months, The Information reported on Friday, citing three people familiar with the matter.

articles.title: Senator Josh Hawley Begins Child Safety Inquiry Into Meta’s A.I. Bot
articles.summary: Josh Hawley, Republican of Missouri, said he would look into whether the social media company’s artificial intelligence technology endangers children.
articles.translated_title: Senator Josh Hawley Begins Child Safety Inquiry Into Meta’s A.I. Bot
articles.translated_summary: Josh Hawley, Republican of Missouri, said he would look into whether the social media company’s artificial intelligence technology endangers children.

articles.title: Trump Eyes Chips Act Funds for Intel Stake | Bloomberg Tech 8/15/2025
articles.summary: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss reports that the Trump administration is eyeing Chips Act funds in order to take a stake in Intel. Plus, Applied Materials shares plunge due to growing trade concerns between the US and China. And OpenAI Chairman of the Board and Sierra CEO Bret Taylor talks about the impact artificial intelligence is having on software and how the OpenAI board is approaching corporate restructuring. (Source: Bloomberg)

articles.title: Sen. Josh Hawley to probe Meta AI policies for children following damning report
articles.summary: Sen. Josh Hawley, R-Mo., said Friday that he will investigate Meta following a report that the company approved rules allowing artificial intelligence chatbots to have certain “romantic” and “sensual” conversations with children

articles.title: Researchers Used AI To Kill Drug-Resistant Bacteria
articles.summary: MIT researchers used AI to kill drug-resistant gonorrhea and MRSA bacteria. Dive into how artificial intelligence facilitated this discovery.
articles.translated_title: Researchers Used AI To Kill Drug-Resistant Bacteria

articles.title: U.S. Senator Hawley launches probe into Meta AI policies
articles.summary: Josh Hawley demanded documents on rules that had allowed Meta's artificial intelligence chatbots to “engage a child in conversations that are romantic or sensual.”
articles.translated_title: U.S. Senator Hawley launches probe into Meta AI policies

articles.title: Beware 'drone-tastic' thinking: UK armed forces chief says 'traditional' capabilities still matter
articles.summary: Adm. Tony Radakin also warned, however, that whoever gets to "artificial super intelligence" first will dominate on the battlefield.
